 * Level Helper class, providing methods dealing with playlist sliding and drift

value.raw: , there should be some duration drift between playlist and fragment!

leadingComments.value: update fragment duration.
it helps to fix drifts between playlist reported duration and fragment real duration
we dont know startPTS[toIdx]
if we know startPTS[toIdx]
update frag PTS/DTS
delta PTS between audio and video

trailingComments.value: exit if sn out of range

leadingComments.value: exit if sn out of range

trailingComments.value: update frag reference in fragments array
rationale is that fragments array might not contain this frag object.
this will happpen if playlist has been refreshed between frag loading and call to updateFragPTSDTS()
if we don't update frag, we won't be able to propagate PTS info on the playlist

leadingComments.value: update frag reference in fragments array
rationale is that fragments array might not contain this frag object.
this will happpen if playlist has been refreshed between frag loading and call to updateFragPTSDTS()
if we don't update frag, we won't be able to propagate PTS info on the playlist
resulting in invalid sliding computation

trailingComments.value: adjust fragment PTS/duration from seqnum-1 to frag 0

trailingComments.value: adjust fragment PTS/duration from seqnum to last frag

trailingComments.value: check if old/new playlists have fragments in common

leadingComments.value: check if old/new playlists have fragments in common

trailingComments.value: loop through overlapping SN and update startPTS , cc, and duration if any found

value.raw: discontinuity sliding from playlist, take drift into account
value.cooked: discontinuity sliding from playlist, take drift into account

trailingComments.value: if at least one fragment contains PTS info, recompute PTS information for all fragments

leadingComments.value: adjust start by sliding offset
ensure that delta is within oldfragments range
also adjust sliding in case delta is 0 (we could have old=[50-60] and new=old=[50-61])
in that case we also need to adjust start offset of all fragments

old and new level. reliable PTS info is thus relying on old level

if we know startPTS[toIdx]
update fragment duration.
it helps to fix drifts between playlist reported duration and fragment real duration
we dont know startPTS[toIdx]
update frag PTS/DTS
delta PTS between audio and video
exit if sn out of range
update frag reference in fragments array
rationale is that fragments array might not contain this frag object.
this will happpen if playlist has been refreshed between frag loading and call to updateFragPTSDTS()
if we don't update frag, we won't be able to propagate PTS info on the playlist
resulting in invalid sliding computation
adjust fragment PTS/duration from seqnum-1 to frag 0

ensure that delta is within oldfragments range

in that case we also need to adjust start offset of all fragments

if we are here, it means we have fragments overlapping between
old and new level. reliable PTS info is thus relying on old level
